meanings.definition: To shorten or reduce in length or size.
meanings.sent1: I had to foreshorten my essay to meet the word limit.
meanings.sent2: She decided to foreshorten her hair for a new look.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to foreshorten the pants, but he accidentally made them too short!
meanings.sent4: The artist skillfully foreshortened the painting to fit the small frame.
meanings.sent5: In order to fit in the suitcase, I had to foreshorten my clothes.

meanings.definition: To represent or portray in a way that gives the illusion of depth or perspective.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used a special lens to foreshorten the image.
meanings.sent2: The artist foreshortened the bridge in the painting to create a sense of distance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made it seem like he could foreshorten objects in his hand.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling skills allowed her to foreshorten the journey in her listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The movie used clever camera angles to foreshorten the scene and make it more dramatic.
